name: fretted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a musical instrument with strings, such as a guitar) having small raised metal bars across the long, thin part, that show you where to put your fingers on the strings in order to produce different notes: Guitars and lutes are fretted musical instruments. There were six pairs of metal strings running over a fretted fingerboard. See
fret
More examplesFewer examplesThe bass viol has a fretted neck and comparatively loose stringing.They produce classic models in every major style of fretted instrument, including acoustic and electric guitars, mandolins, and banjos.The large lute had six strings above a fretted fingerboard.

(of a hard material such as wood or metal) decorated with a pattern cut into it: A broad black patent leather belt was pulled through a fretted silver buckle. The chancel of the Cathedral is marked off from the nave by a fretted screen.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is a colonial-style mansion with a fretted wood balcony on the side.The 1820 table supports a fretted reading stand.The radio was made of light wood with two large circular openings, one with a fretted front, the other fitted with a dial.
